verses.text: 在山上改變形象過了六天，耶穌帶著彼得、雅各和雅各的弟弟約翰，領他們悄悄地上了高山。
耶穌在他們面前改變了形象，臉好像太陽一樣照耀，衣服潔白像光。
忽然，摩西和以利亞向他們顯現，跟耶穌談話。
彼得對耶穌說：「主啊，我們在這裡真好。如果你願意，我就在這裡搭三個帳棚，一個為你，一個為摩西，一個為以利亞。」
彼得還說話的時候，有一朵明亮的雲彩籠罩他們，雲中有聲音說：「這是我的愛子，我所喜悅的，你們要聽他。」

words.note: A term of endearment, often used in scripture for Jesus.

verses.text: 門徒聽見了，就俯伏在地上，非常害怕。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower'; a student or adherent.
Often implies reverence or fear in biblical contexts.
Lit. 'not ordinary'.

verses.text: 耶穌前來，摸著他們說：「起來，不用怕。」

words.definition: no need to, don't have to

verses.text: 他們抬起頭來，看見只有耶穌自己，沒有別的人。

words.definition: to lift one's head, look up
words.note: An idiomatic expression meaning to raise one's head.

verses.text: 他們下山的時候，耶穌吩咐他們：「人子從死人中復活以前，你們不要把所看見的異象告訴人。」

words.note: A messianic title used by Jesus for himself.
Lit. 'return to life'.
Indicates the object is being acted upon or disposed of.
A grammatical particle used to form a nominal phrase.
Often refers to divine visions in religious texts.

verses.text: 門徒就問他：「那麼經學家為甚麼說，以利亞必須先來呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'door follower'; a student or adherent.
Refers to Jewish religious scholars or copyists of the law.

verses.text: 他回答：「以利亞當然要來，並且復興一切。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for spiritual revival.

verses.text: 但我告訴你們，以利亞已經來了，可是人們卻不認識他，反而任意待他。照樣，人子也要這樣被他們苦待。」

words.note: A title Jesus often used for himself in the Gospels.

verses.text: 這時門徒才領悟，耶穌是指著施洗的約翰說的。

words.note: Refers specifically to followers of a religious teacher or master.
Lit. 'John who baptizes'.
Used here to emphasize the preceding verb, similar to 'it was...that'.

verses.text: 治好癲癇病的小孩耶穌和門徒來到群眾那裡，有一個人前來，跪下對耶穌說：

words.note: Historical term for 'falling sickness'.

verses.text: 「主啊，可憐我的兒子吧，他患了癲癇病，非常痛苦，好幾次掉進火裡和水中。

words.note: A respectful address to God or Jesus.

verses.text: 我帶他去見你的門徒，他們卻不能醫好他。」

words.note: Lit. 'school apprentice'

verses.text: 耶穌說：「唉！這又不信又乖謬的世代啊！我要跟你們在一起到幾時呢？我要忍受你們到幾時呢？把孩子帶到我這裡來吧。」
耶穌斥責那鬼，鬼就從孩子身上出來；從那時起，孩子就好了。

words.note: Often refers to an evil spirit in Biblical contexts.

verses.text: 門徒悄悄地前來問耶穌：「為甚麼我們不能把鬼趕出去呢？」
他說：「因為你們的信心太小了。我實在告訴你們，只要你們的信心像一粒芥菜種，就是對這山說：『從這裡移到那裡』，它也必移開。沒有甚麼是你們不能作的。」

words.note: More emphatic than '會' (will) in classical/biblical texts.

verses.text: （有些抄本有第21節：「這一類的鬼，如果不靠禱告和禁食，是趕不出來的。」）

words.note: Used for Bible verses or chapter sections.
In biblical context, refers to evil spirits or demons.
A common verb-object compound in religious contexts.
Meaning 'abstain from food', specifically for religious reasons.

verses.text: 第二次預言受難及復活他們聚集在加利利的時候，耶穌對門徒說：「人子將要被交在人的手裡，

words.note: Used for divine predictions or prophecies.
Refers to Christ's suffering and crucifixion.
Specifically refers to rising from the dead.
Refers to followers, especially of Jesus.
A title Jesus used for himself, signifying both humanity and divine authority.

verses.text: 他們要殺害他，第三天他要復活。」他們就很憂愁。

words.note: Specifically refers to rising from the dead.

verses.text: 繳納殿稅他們來到迦百農，收殿稅的人前來對彼得說：「你們的老師不納稅嗎？」

words.note: Often used for paying taxes or fees.
A specific tax for the upkeep of the Temple.
A specific tax for the upkeep of the Temple.

verses.text: 他說：「納。」他進到屋子裡，耶穌先問他：「西門，你認為怎樣？地上的君王向誰徵收關稅和丁稅？向自己的兒子還是外人呢？」

words.note: Short for 繳納 or 納稅 in this context.
A tax levied on individuals, often per household or adult male.

verses.text: 他回答：「外人。」耶穌對他說：「這樣，兒子就可以免稅了。

words.note: Lit. 'outside person', referring to non-citizens or non-members.
Verb-object compound: 免 (exempt) + 稅 (tax).

verses.text: 但為了避免觸犯他們，你要到海邊去釣魚；把第一條釣上來的魚拿起來，打開魚的嘴，你就會找到一個大銀幣。你可以拿去交給他們作你我的殿稅。」

words.note: Lit. 'touch and violate'.
Indicates direction or purpose.
Verb-object compound: 釣 (fish with hook) + 魚 (fish).
V-上-來: indicates catching something from below to above.
V-起-來: indicates movement from down to up, or starting an action.
Lit. 'hit open'.
V-到 indicates successful completion of a verb.
V-去 indicates taking something away from the speaker.
Specifically refers to the tax for the Temple.
